title: Construction Project Engineer
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a motivated and detail\-oriented Project Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in overseeing construction projects from inception to completion, ensuring that all aspects of the project are executed efficiently and effectively. This position requires strong organizational skills, proficiency in construction management software, and the ability to coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously.

**Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
* Develop and maintain project schedules in coordination with the contractor.
* Coordinate construction activities on\-site, ensuring compliance with safety regulations and quality standards.
* Utilize Bluebeam for document management, including reviewing plans, specifications, and contracts.
* Monitor project progress and adjust schedules as necessary to meet deadlines.
* Facilitate communication between team members, subcontractors, and clients to ensure alignment on project goals.
* Assist in the preparation of reports detailing project status, challenges, and solutions.
* Conduct site visits to assess progress and address any issues that may arise during construction.
* Manage submittals, RFIs, drawing logs, and meeting minutes
* Assist with construction document tracking and updates
* Read and interpret plans, specifications, and technical documents
* Maintain proactive communication with contractors and designers
* Coordinate field activities and daily inspections
* Support permit expediting with LADBS, DOT, DWP, DPW, and other agencies

**Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field is preferred.
* Proven experience in construction management or engineering roles is highly desirable.
* Utility and 3rd Party coordination experience preferred
* Experience on LA\-based infrastructure or public works projects REQUIRED
* Familiarity with construction site operations and safety protocols.
* Strong time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
* Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with diverse teams.

Join our team as a Project Engineer where you can contribute your expertise while growing your career in a supportive environment focused on excellence in construction management.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $100,000\.00 \- $180,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

License/Certification:

* Professional Engineer License (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Los Angeles, CA 90045 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Dispatcher
description:
Direct and coordinate the activities of owner operators and third\-party carriers in the performance of freight delivery services. Monitor load readiness for dispatch from the distribution center and coordinate delivery times and instructions with the receiving locations, distribution center and backhaul vendors. Interact with customer employees, contractors/drivers, and personnel at delivery points to assure prompt and efficient movement of freight while maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements governing driver hours of service. Direct the response to interruptions in delivery schedules due to weather, road blockages, equipment breakdown and other unexpected occurrences.

* Monitor status of deliveries in progress and maintain contact with contractors/drivers who are outside their window of delivery. Advise receiving location of drivers ETA. Where feasible, re\-route truck in order to maintain on time delivery schedule for down line stops.
* Utilize Company software to enter load progress and delivery data on a real time basis.
* Assist or stand in for the Load Planner as required, including utilizing the dedicated driver list and current available driving hours report to plan loads to be dispatched using the load planner spread sheet.
* Assist or stand in for the Load Planner as required, including matching loads to drivers in conformity with the Companys no\-forced dispatch policy. Where loads go unmatched, determine means to incentivize a contractor/driver to take the load.
* Monitor status of contractors/drivers coming in to the facility and due at dispatch window for predetermined load tender time.
* Where loads cannot be assigned to owner operators under contract to Company, assign loads to an approved third\-party carrier. Prepare routing and delivery instructions for the third party driver and present in\-person orientation of third party driver at the time the load is tendered.
* Where breakdowns occur during transit, arrange response by a road repair/towing service. If repowering is required, determine the most expeditious means to dispatch a replacement unit and to facilitate the delivery.
* Maintain communication with the Back Haul Coordinator to assure that back hauls are promptly and efficiently integrated into load plans.
* Prepare and continually update all required reports, including status reports, daily reports, inbound reports, and weather reports.
* Continually monitor and track the location of the trucks and trailers through computerized tracking software.
* Continually monitor trailer operating status, including refrigeration unit temperature settings, actual temperature readings, fuel levels and alarm codes.
* Utilize internet based applications for monitoring, mapping, locating and/or calculating mileage distance or transit times.
* Promote and enhance the Companys relationship and reputation with its corps of owner operators. Remain accessible to the owner operators to answer questions or advise them with regard to specific problems or concerns.
* Promptly and professionally respond to all inquiries and directives from customer representatives.
* Accurately and timely complete all reports and forms required by the Company or its customers.
* Act professionally and ethically at all times.
* Keep immediate work area safe, clean and organized at all times.
* Other duties as may be assigned from time to time.
* HOURS: **Sunday\- Thursday 11pm \- 7am**




High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and 2 to 3 years of experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience within the distribution and/or transportation industry.

* Ability to learn the service area and delivery locations to coordinate drivers deliveries.
* Knowledge of distribution and transportation industry.
* Experience using computerized routing software.
* Excellent organization skills, with the ability to multitask.
* Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.
* Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
* Strong customer orientation.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Commitment to company values.
* Computer proficiency.

Sedentary office environment. Exerts up to 25 lbs. of force to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to work in an office, but may be required to spend a portion of the time in a warehouse, or outdoor trailer yard.

title: Accounting & Financial Operations Associate
description:
**Accounting \& Financial Operations Associate**
================================================

**Employment Type:** Remote, Overseas Contractor

**Reports To:** Vice President of Finance Business Processes and Systems (VPoFP)

**Work Schedule \& Availability:** Must be available to work during U.S. business hours, specifically between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM Eastern Time




**Company Overview**
--------------------


Brains \& Motion Education (BAM!) runs popular after school enrichment programs at elementary schools in a growing number of cities across the country. Schools and parents love us for offering a mix of games, sports, robotics, coding, digital arts, and other STEM Without Screens™ topics. Known for our fun, educational, reliable programs and supportive and well\-trained instructors, we are backed by prominent investors in the education sector.

**Position Overview**
---------------------


We are seeking a highly organized and detail\-oriented Accounting \& Financial Operations Assistant with a strong continuous improvement mindset and can take initiative to complete tasks with limited guidance. This role focuses on accounting, financial, and operational processes, compliance, financial reporting, process optimization, and special projects. The ideal candidate has experience in one or more of the following areas: payroll, billing and accounts receivables, accounts payable, compliance, financial reporting, and process improvement. They bring strong communication, organization, and project management skills with a proven ability to collaborate and coordinate across departments. They have experience working with different types of organizational software systems, including payroll or customer relationship management software.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

#### ***Accounting and Financial Operations***

* Revenue \& Accounts Receivable – Invoicing
	+ Review, approve, and ensure all customer invoices are accurate, sent timely, and compliant with contract terms, including reflecting actuals when appropriate
	+ Analyze and streamline billing workflows, including non\-standard invoicing practices
	+ Support accounts receivable tracking, cash application, reconciliation, and reporting
	+ Maintain contract table and understanding of billing terms
* Support finance functions and liaison between BAM and Accounting team, Consero, as needed
	+ Accounts payable process \- support CFO in account management
	+ Accounting and FP\&A \- work across the organization to help gather or share information as needed

#### ***Compliance and Reporting***

* Assist CFO in tracking and maintaining state compliance and registration
* Assist HR and Payroll in maintaining compliance with unemployment insurance and workers’ compensation requirements, including timely claims responses, accurate reporting, and organized recordkeeping
* Maintain tracking and work flows related to compliance and reporting
* Assist CFO in completing insurance and other applications and preparing and organizing related documentation
* Clean file structure and maintain proper documentation

#### ***Mail \& Document Processing***

* Triage incoming mail via Earth Class Mail (ECM), BAM’s electronic mails service system
* Take prompt action to complete or comply with the following:
	+ State tax and compliance forms
	+ Unemployment inquiries
	+ Wage garnishments
	+ Other documents or requests as they come into the ECM system
* Set up process to make sure all mail has been either handled by finance or the appropriate stakeholder

#### ***Process Improvement and Systems Optimization***

* Assist VPoFP in systems building and process improvement, as needed


	+ Developing training materials
	+ Cleaning and inputting data
	+ Designing workflow and process documentation

#### ***Special Project and Ad\-Hoc Responsibilities***

* Participate in system implementations, special analyses, and regulatory updates
* Contribute to cross\-departmental projects ensuring alignment of financial strategies

**Required Skills, Competencies, and Qualifications**
-----------------------------------------------------

#### ***Education \& Experience***

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business, or a related field
* 3\+ years of experience in accounting, finance, operations, or project management

#### ***Skills \& Competencies***

* Accounting Expertise: Proficiency in accounts receivable, accounts payable, invoicing, and reconciliations
* Compliance Knowledge: Familiarity with federal and state tax regulations, payroll compliance, and workers' compensation requirements
* System Proficiency: Experience with Salesforce, ERP systems, Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivables systems (e.g., Sage Intacct, Bill.com), and payroll systems (e.g., Paycom, Paychex). Ability to learn new systems quickly.
* Technical Skills: Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
* Analytical Abilities: Strong attention to detail, problem\-solving skills, and ability to conduct variance analysis
* Process Improvement: Ability to identify and address operational inefficiencies and implement scalable solutions with appropriate assistance from the Chief Financial Officer and other stakeholders
* Project Management: Strong organizational and time\-management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively
* Communication \& Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills, with experience working across teams and functions

#### ***Preferred Qualifications***

* Experience in the education sector
* Prior experience in public accounting or working within a multi\-entity organization

#### ***Other Requirements***

* Must have reliable internet access
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English required

title: VP of Commercial Construction
description:
Bravos Construction is seeking a Vice President of Commercial Construction is a senior executive responsible for overseeing all aspects of a company’s construction operations. This includes strategic planning, project execution, budgeting, staffing, and quality control. The VP ensures projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality and safety standards while aligning with company goals.


Key Responsibilities:


* Strategic Leadership:
* Develop and implement short\- and long\-term construction strategies.
* Set goals, KPIs, and benchmarks for project performance and profitability.
* Project Oversight:
* Oversee multiple large\-scale construction projects from planning to completion.
* Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.
* Monitor timelines, budgets, and resources, intervening as necessary.
* Team Management:
* Lead and mentor project managers, superintendents, and other construction staff.
* Oversee recruitment, training, and performance evaluations of construction personnel.
* Budget \& Cost Control:
* Develop and manage construction budgets.
* Approve expenditures and negotiate contracts with vendors, subcontractors, and suppliers.
* Quality \& Safety Assurance:
* Promote and enforce high standards for job site safety and construction quality.
* Oversee inspections and ensure adherence to codes and best practices.
* Stakeholder Communication:
* Serve as a liaison between construction teams, executive leadership, clients, and investors.
* Prepare and deliver regular updates and reports on project status and company performance.

Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Commercial Construction, Architecture, or related field (Master’s preferred).


10\+ years of experience in construction, with 5\+ years in a senior leadership role.


Strong knowledge of construction methods, safety regulations, budgeting, and project management.


Proven track record of leading complex construction projects on time and within budget.


Excellent leadership, communication, and negotiation skills.


Preferred Skills:


Proficiency with project management software (e.g., Procore, Primavera, MS Project).


LEED certification or knowledge of sustainable building practices.


**Experience in commercial sectors preferably in restaurants, retail and QSR industry**

title: Civil Engineer, Sr. - Site, Grading & Drainage Reviewer for Construction
description:
**Position Description**
------------------------


The **Seattle Department of Construction and Inspections (SDCI)** is seeking to hire a **Civil Engineer, Sr\- Site, for Site, Grading and Drainage Review**. The position will perform plan review for compliance with the Seattle Stormwater Code, Side Sewer Code, and Grading Code. A portion of this review position is spent coaching the public in the City of Seattle Portal. This position works with building owners, architects, engineers, contractors, developers, and inspectors regarding drainage plans and code requirements. This position requires proficiency in hydrologic modeling and the capacity to coach others.  


**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


* Review building permit applications and plans to ensure compliance with applicable codes for drainage, sewer, grading, and erosion control issues. This includes but is not limited to flow control, source control, water quality, Onsite Stormwater Management (OSM), temporary construction stormwater control, grading and soil amendment.
* Provide advanced hydrologic modeling review using MGS Flood and WWHM and coach others
* Assist in Code and Director's Rule development for issues that may impact SDCI's customers
* Provide coaching for applicants, homeowners, neighborhood groups, architects, inspectors, engineers and other design professionals
* Serve as a point of contact regarding private property stormwater issues for co\-workers within SDCI, and other City Departments and public agencies
* Understand and commit to actively supporting the City and Department goals in promoting racial equity and social justice
**Qualifications**
------------------


Requires five years professional civil engineering experience and a Bachelor Degree in Civil Engineering or Civil Engineering Technology; (or a combination of education and/or training and/or experience, which provides an equivalent background required to perform the work of the class).  

**License, Certification and Other Requirements**

* Registration as a Professional Engineer in the State of Washington.
* Current Washington State driver's license or evidence of equivalent mobility.
**Successful applicants will have experience and expertise encompassing the following areas:**  

* Ability to read and interpret plans, drawings and determine the complexity of requirements for the site
* Ability to perform advanced hydrologic modeling review using MGS Flood and WWHM and the ability to train and provide guidance for staff
* Work under limited supervision and provide guidance to other technical staff. Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
* Self\-starter, highly organized with good written and oral communication skills, especially when conveying technical code information
* Ability to work as a team member
* Ability and willingness to learn and adapt to rapidly changing new technologies.
* Desired computer skills include MS Excel, GIS software, WWHM, CAD, Blue Beam, MGS Flood

**Additional Information**
--------------------------


To be considered for this position, please submit the following with your online application:

  

* A cover letter in which you clearly describe how your knowledge, experience, skills, and abilities prepare you for the job responsibilities and qualifications outlined in the job advertisement
* A current resume outlining your relevant work experience

  

The full salary range for this position is $72\.38 \- $84\.28 per hour.  

  

**The Seattle Department of Construction and Inspections is a proud participant in the Race and Social Justice Initiative, a Citywide effort to realize the vision of racial equity.**  

  

**We require a strong commitment to customer service and a demonstrated ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse communities and cultures. The City of Seattle values diverse perspectives and life experiences; people of color, women, LGBTQ, people with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply.**  

  

*Benefits*  

*The City of Seattle offers a comprehensive benefits package including vacation, holiday, and sick leave as well as medical, dental, vision, life and long\-term disability insurance for employees and their dependents. More information about employee benefits is available on the City's website at:* *https://www.seattle.gov/human\-resources/benefits/employees\-and\-covered\-family\-members/most\-employees\-plans*
  
The City of Seattle offers a comprehensive benefits package including vacation, holiday and sick leave as well as medical, dental, vision, life and long\-term disability insurance for employees and their dependents.
